categories.name: A Symphony of Soups: International Varieties

questions.clue: For $200, this Italian soup, whose name means 'pasta and beans,' could be the perfect post-gig meal for an indie band.
This spicy Mexican soup made from tripe and hominy is eaten after festive nights out, much like your favorite indie anthem.
Originating from Thailand, this tangy soup, perfect for a strong post-workout refuel, is known for its harmonious blend of lemongrass, lime, and chili.
What is the Korean soup made with beef bones and garlic, known for its restorative properties, making it ideal after a heavy body-building session?
This rich Russian soup, named for the color of its star ingredient, includes beets and is as complex as an indie rock ballad.
This Brooklyn band, known for hits like 'A-Punk', named one of their albums after a type of Japanese soup noodle.
Formed in Nevada, this indie rock band gained fame in the 2000s with hits like 'Somebody Told Me' and 'Mr. Brightside'.
This Canadian collective has a unique sound that combines indie rock with orchestral elements, as showcased in their debut album 'Funeral'.
Known for their distinct vocals and introspective lyrics, this duo from Ohio became influential indie rock icons in the 2000s.
Emerging as a solo act from the project Bright Eyes, this indie musician is known for emotionally charged lyrics and a distinctive voice.

categories.name: Sculpting Strength: Bodybuilding Through the Ages

questions.clue: This film actor, famous for his role as Conan the Barbarian, won the Mr. Olympia bodybuilding contest 7 times.
Known as the 'Blond Bomber,' this bodybuilder became the first to win both the Mr. America and Mr. Universe titles.
This 1977 documentary details the rivalry between Arnold Schwarzenegger and Lou Ferrigno as they compete for the Mr. Olympia title.
Named after a hymenopterous insect, this sculpting pose emphasizes the upper body and involves flexing the lats.
A pioneer in the bodybuilding world, this woman became the first Ms. Olympia in 1980, paving the way for female bodybuilders.

categories.name: World Capitals: History Hidden in Their Streets

questions.clue: For 200: This capital city features a historic quarter where the aroma of borscht often fills the air, reflecting its rich culinary heritage.
For 400: Known for its indie music scene, Camden Market in this capital offers a glimpse into the colorful post-war subcultures that have flourished there.
For 600: In this capital, the Street of the 6th of May marks the date of Italy's unification, celebrated throughout the city's wide boulevards.
For 800: A place where the Champs-Élysées meets the Arc de Triomphe, this city is also a mecca for both high fashion and bodybuilders attending annual fitness expos.
For 1000: Sheikh Jarrah, a street in this capital city, carries a history of conflict and coexistence, echoing the city's complex past and diverse population.

categories.name: Literary Figures: Famous Authors' Lesser-Known Works

questions.clue: Before writing 'Pride and Prejudice', Jane Austen penned this short epistolary novella about family loyalties and betrayals.
Known for 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer', Mark Twain also wrote this novel about a Connecticut engineer who travels to 6th-century England.
questions.answer: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

questions.clue: Ernest Hemingway, a fan of boxing, explored his love for animals in this 1932 narrative non-fiction work set in Africa.
Known for her 'Harry Potter' series, J.K. Rowling published this series under the pseudonym Robert Galbraith, featuring detective Cormoran Strike.
This Russian author of 'War and Peace' explored vegetarianism and Christian anarchism in his essay 'The Kingdom of God Is Within You'.

final.clue: This indie band, known for 'The Funeral', shares part of its name with a type of hearty soup often made with beef or chicken broth, chunks of vegetables, and barley.
